result.execSummary:
The defendant August T. Shimkus II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked, huber priveleges granted for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 2 and to any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so.
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jenica Zettler
*Write letter of apology to Jenica Zettler and provide to agent for approval.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. August T. Shimkus II

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from Atty Brian T Kane dated 06/17/16 in re:  request for copy of JOC

Defendant August T. Shimkus in court with attorney Brian T. Kane.  Defendant, August T Shimkus, in custody.  David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:15 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3 & 4 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Victim notification has been complied with by the State and no restitution request submitted by the victim.
Atty Kane makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 90 day jail sentence concurrent to Count 2 and concurrent to any other sentence
If probation revoked:
*Huber priveleges granted for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
*50 days jail credit
Placed on Probation for 18 months:
**Conditions of Probation:
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so.
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Jenica Zettler
*Write letter of apology to Jenica Zettler and provide to agent for approval

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay a 90 day jail sentence concurrent with Count 1 and concurrent to any other sentence
If probation revoked:
*Huber priveleges granted for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.
*50 days jail credit
Placed on Probation for 18 months:
**Conditions of Probation:
*Comply with conditions in Count 1 
*Pay costs

Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI
Plea hearing on June 2, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Plea hearing on July 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant August T. Shimkus appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes statements.  Asks for a signature bond to resolve warrants in Wood County. 
Atty Cousins makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 

BY THE COURT:  Motion denied.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Not be on the premises of Graffiti's. 
No contact Jenica Zettler, direct or indirect. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *7 times per week, in addition to PTSP.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Defendant makes additional statements to the Court. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  2/22/16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
